sourcesContent:
import React from 'react'
  import { MDXTag } from '@mdx-js/tag'
  

export default class MDXContent extends React.Component {
  constructor(props) {
    super(props)
    this.layout = null
  }
  render() {
    const { components, ...props } = this.props

    return <MDXTag
             name="wrapper"
             
             components={components}><MDXTag name="h1" components={components} props={{"id":"kubernetes-dashboard"}}>{`Kubernetes Dashboard`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`This belongs to the Kubernetes project and gives you a UI overview of what is going on.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`It displays info about:`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Workload (Deployments, Pods, ReplicationSets)`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Namespaces`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Services`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Nodes & Storage`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Usage Metrics (Heapster monitoring required)`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`The dashboard can also execute commands based on propr RBAC permissions.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Security:`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`HTTPS`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Login via Bearer token`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`RBAC to define fine-grain access to UI components`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`More info can be found `}<MDXTag name="a" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"href":"https://github.com/kubernetes/dashboard"}}>{`https://github.com/kubernetes/dashboard`}</MDXTag>{`.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`What the setup for us will look like when touching base with the dashboard:`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://res.cloudinary.com/gitgoodclub/image/upload/v1548218031/eks-course/Screen_Shot_2019-01-23_at_3.33.27_pm.png","alt":"Dashboard access layout"}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"steps-to-take"}}>{`Steps to take`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ol" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Create service account and RBAC rules`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Deploy dashboard`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Deploy metrics Add-Ons`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Create cluster admin account and explore dashboard`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`We need to create:`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ol" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`A service account for the dashboard`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Several roles to grant privileges (RBAC) to the dashboard`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`A role binding to link the service account to the RBAC roles`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"creating-the-serviceaccount-and-roles"}}>{`Creating the ServiceAccount and Roles`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`First, we handle the RBAC by creating the `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`ServiceAccount`}</MDXTag>{` and `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`Role`}</MDXTag>{` and then using a `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`RoleBinding`}</MDXTag>{` to attach that Role to the Service Account.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`dashboard-account-rab.yaml:`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="pre" components={components}><MDXTag name="code" components={components} parentName="pre" props={{"className":"language-yaml"}}>{`# ------------------- Dashboard Service Account ------------------- #

apiVersion: v1
kind: ServiceAccount
metadata:
  labels:
    k8s-app: kubernetes-dashboard
  name: kubernetes-dashboard
  namespace: kube-system

---
# ------------------- Dashboard Role & Role Binding ------------------- #

kind: Role
apiVersion: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1
metadata:
  name: kubernetes-dashboard-minimal
  namespace: kube-system
rules:
  # Allow Dashboard to create 'kubernetes-dashboard-key-holder' secret.
  - apiGroups: ['']
    resources: ['secrets']
    verbs: ['create']
    # Allow Dashboard to create 'kubernetes-dashboard-settings' config map.
  - apiGroups: ['']
    resources: ['configmaps']
    verbs: ['create']
    # Allow Dashboard to get, update and delete Dashboard exclusive secrets.
  - apiGroups: ['']
    resources: ['secrets']
    resourceNames:
      ['kubernetes-dashboard-key-holder', 'kubernetes-dashboard-certs']
    verbs: ['get', 'update', 'delete']
    # Allow Dashboard to get and update 'kubernetes-dashboard-settings' config map.
  - apiGroups: ['']
    resources: ['configmaps']
    resourceNames: ['kubernetes-dashboard-settings']
    verbs: ['get', 'update']
    # Allow Dashboard to get metrics from heapster.
  - apiGroups: ['']
    resources: ['services']
    resourceNames: ['heapster']
    verbs: ['proxy']
  - apiGroups: ['']
    resources: ['services/proxy']
    resourceNames: ['heapster', 'http:heapster:', 'https:heapster:']
    verbs: ['get']

---
apiVersion: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1
kind: RoleBinding
metadata:
  name: kubernetes-dashboard-minimal
  namespace: kube-system
roleRef:
  # Reference role we created above
  apiGroup: rbac.authorization.k8s.io
  kind: Role
  name: kubernetes-dashboard-minimal
subjects:
  # Attach RoleBinding to Service Account we first created
  - kind: ServiceAccount
    name: kubernetes-dashboard
    namespace: kube-system

---
`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"deploying-the-dashboard"}}>{`Deploying the dashboard`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://res.cloudinary.com/gitgoodclub/image/upload/v1548219837/eks-course/Screen_Shot_2019-01-23_at_4.03.45_pm.png","alt":"Layout"}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`There will be 3 resources created in the lecture:`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ol" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Service: fixed port, fixed url, user facing`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Deployment: Dashboard pod -- port 8443 (can live on any host)`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Volume: This will contain our secret certificates`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`This is all stored in the `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`deploy-dashboard.yml`}</MDXTag>{` file:`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="pre" components={components}><MDXTag name="code" components={components} parentName="pre" props={{"className":"language-yaml"}}>{`# Copyright 2017 The Kubernetes Authors.
#
# Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
# you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
# You may obtain a copy of the License at
#
#     http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
#
# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
# distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
# WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
# See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
# limitations under the License.

# ------------------- Dashboard Secret ------------------- #

apiVersion: v1
kind: Secret
metadata:
  labels:
    # Using this to match easily
    k8s-app: kubernetes-dashboard
  name: kubernetes-dashboard-certs
  namespace: kube-system
type: Opaque

---
# ------------------- Dashboard Deployment ------------------- #

kind: Deployment
apiVersion: apps/v1beta2
metadata:
  labels:
    k8s-app: kubernetes-dashboard
  # Used for Service to target
  name: kubernetes-dashboard
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  replicas: 1
  revisionHistoryLimit: 10
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: kubernetes-dashboard
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        k8s-app: kubernetes-dashboard
    spec:
      containers:
        - name: kubernetes-dashboard
          image: k8s.gcr.io/kubernetes-dashboard-amd64:v1.10.0
          # Used for Service to expose
          ports:
            - containerPort: 8443
              protocol: TCP
          args:
            - --auto-generate-certificates
            # Uncomment the following line to manually specify Kubernetes API server Host
            # If not specified, Dashboard will attempt to auto discover the API server and connect
            # to it. Uncomment only if the default does not work.
            # - --apiserver-host=http://my-address:port
          volumeMounts:
            - name: kubernetes-dashboard-certs
              mountPath: /certs
              # Create on-disk volume to store exec logs
            - mountPath: /tmp
              name: tmp-volume
          livenessProbe:
            httpGet:
              scheme: HTTPS
              path: /
              port: 8443
            initialDelaySeconds: 30
            timeoutSeconds: 30
      volumes:
        - name: kubernetes-dashboard-certs
          secret:
            secretName: kubernetes-dashboard-certs
        - name: tmp-volume
          emptyDir: {}
      serviceAccountName: kubernetes-dashboard
      # Comment the following tolerations if Dashboard must not be deployed on master
      tolerations:
        - key: node-role.kubernetes.io/master
          effect: NoSchedule

---
# ------------------- Dashboard Service ------------------- #

kind: Service
apiVersion: v1
metadata:
  labels:
    k8s-app: kubernetes-dashboard
  name: kubernetes-dashboard
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  ports:
    - port: 443
      targetPort: 8443
  selector:
    k8s-app: kubernetes-dashboard
`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`After we applying the yaml file, we can see what we've created using `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`kubectl get all --namespace kube-system --selector=k8s-app=kubernetes-dashboard`}</MDXTag>{`.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`We can get even more granular with:`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="pre" components={components}><MDXTag name="code" components={components} parentName="pre" props={{"className":"language-shell"}}>{`kubectl get svc --namespace kube-system --selector=k8s-app=kubernetes-dashboard
kubectl get pods --namespace kube-system --selector=k8s-app=kubernetes-dashboard
kubectl get deployments --namespace kube-system --selector=k8s-app=kubernetes-dashboard
kubectl get replicasets --namespace kube-system --selector=k8s-app=kubernetes-dashboard
`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"deploying-the-metrics-add-on"}}>{`Deploying the metrics add-on`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://res.cloudinary.com/gitgoodclub/image/upload/v1548221185/eks-course/Screen_Shot_2019-01-23_at_4.26.16_pm.png","alt":"Heapster Kubernetes resources"}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`We will deploy Heapster and that is made up of three Kubernetes resources: a service, deployment and service account.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://res.cloudinary.com/gitgoodclub/image/upload/v1548221289/eks-course/Screen_Shot_2019-01-23_at_4.28.00_pm.png","alt":"InfluxDB resources"}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`We will also deploy InfluxDB to store its data. The Heapster deployment will interface with the InfluxDB service.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}><MDXTag name="img" components={components} parentName="p" props={{"src":"https://res.cloudinary.com/gitgoodclub/image/upload/v1548221371/eks-course/Screen_Shot_2019-01-23_at_4.29.21_pm.png","alt":"Full connection"}}></MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"deploying-influxdb"}}>{`Deploying InfluxDB`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="pre" components={components}><MDXTag name="code" components={components} parentName="pre" props={{"className":"language-yaml"}}>{`apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: monitoring-influxdb
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  replicas: 1
  template:
    metadata:
      # label k8s-app used for Service spec
      labels:
        task: monitoring
        k8s-app: influxdb
    spec:
      containers:
        - name: influxdb
          image: k8s.gcr.io/heapster-influxdb-amd64:v1.5.2
          volumeMounts:
            - mountPath: /data
              name: influxdb-storage
      volumes:
        - name: influxdb-storage
          emptyDir: {}
---
apiVersion: v1
kind: Service
metadata:
  labels:
    task: monitoring
    # For use as a Cluster add-on (https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/tree/master/cluster/addons)
    # If you are NOT using this as an addon, you should comment out this line.
    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: 'true'
    kubernetes.io/name: monitoring-influxdb
  name: monitoring-influxdb
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  ports:
    - port: 8086
      targetPort: 8086
  # What Service should be linked to
  selector:
    k8s-app: influxdb
`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"deploying-heapter"}}>{`Deploying Heapter`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="pre" components={components}><MDXTag name="code" components={components} parentName="pre" props={{"className":"language-yml"}}>{`apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: heapster
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  replicas: 1
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        task: monitoring
        k8s-app: heapster
    spec:
      serviceAccountName: heapster
      containers:
        - name: heapster
          image: k8s.gcr.io/heapster-amd64:v1.5.4
          imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
          command:
            - /heapster
            - --source=kubernetes:https://kubernetes.default
            - --sink=influxdb:http://monitoring-influxdb.kube-system.svc:8086
---
apiVersion: v1
kind: Service
metadata:
  labels:
    task: monitoring
    # For use as a Cluster add-on (https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/tree/master/cluster/addons)
    # If you are NOT using this as an addon, you should comment out this line.
    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: 'true'
    kubernetes.io/name: Heapster
  name: heapster
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  ports:
    - port: 80
      targetPort: 8082
  selector:
    k8s-app: heapster
`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h3" components={components} props={{"id":"deploying-heapster-rbac"}}>{`Deploying Heapster RBAC`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="pre" components={components}><MDXTag name="code" components={components} parentName="pre" props={{"className":"language-yaml"}}>{`apiVersion: v1
kind: ServiceAccount
metadata:
  name: heapster
  namespace: kube-system
---
kind: ClusterRoleBinding
apiVersion: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1beta1
metadata:
  name: heapster
roleRef:
  apiGroup: rbac.authorization.k8s.io
  kind: ClusterRole
  name: system:heapster
subjects:
  - kind: ServiceAccount
    name: heapster
    namespace: kube-system
`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"deploying-heapster-and-influxdb"}}>{`Deploying Heapster and Influx.db`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Applying these deployments to the cluster:`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="pre" components={components}><MDXTag name="code" components={components} parentName="pre" props={{"className":"language-shell"}}>{`kubectl apply -f deploy-heapster.yml
kubectl apply -f deploy-influxdb.yml
kubectl apply -f deploy-heapster-rbac.yml
`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Using a selector see what we built:`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="pre" components={components}><MDXTag name="code" components={components} parentName="pre" props={{"className":"language-shell"}}>{`kubectl get all --namespace kube-system --selector=task=monitoring
`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Applying the above should return something like:`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="pre" components={components}><MDXTag name="code" components={components} parentName="pre" props={{"className":"language-shell"}}>{`NAME                                       READY   STATUS    RESTARTS   AGE
pod/heapster-84c9bc48c4-lph2v              1/1     Running   0          1m
pod/monitoring-influxdb-848b9b66f6-7tkcv   1/1     Running   0          2m

NAME                          TYPE        CLUSTER-IP       EXTERNAL-IP   PORT(S)    AGE
service/heapster              ClusterIP   [REDACTED]      <none>        80/TCP     3m
service/monitoring-influxdb   ClusterIP   [REDACTED]      <none>        8086/TCP   2m

NAME                                  DESIRED   CURRENT   UP-TO-DATE   AVAILABLE   AGE
deployment.apps/heapster              1         1         1            1           3m
deployment.apps/monitoring-influxdb   1         1         1            1           2m

NAME                                             DESIRED   CURRENT   READY   AGE
replicaset.apps/heapster-84c9bc48c4              1         1         1       3m
replicaset.apps/monitoring-influxdb-848b9b66f6   1         1         1       2m
`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Note that Kubernetes `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`Deployments`}</MDXTag>{` provides declarative updates for `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`Pods`}</MDXTag>{` and `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`ReplicaSets`}</MDXTag>{`.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`See `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/deployment/`}</MDXTag>{` for more info.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"creating-an-admin-account-to-use-the-dashboard"}}>{`Creating an Admin Account to use the dashboard`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Using YAML, we'll create:`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ol" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`cluster admin account`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Role binding`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Then we can start the `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`kubectl proxy`}</MDXTag>{` to authenticate the K8s dashboard and explore the dashboard.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"creating-the-admin-service-account"}}>{`Creating the admin Service Account`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="pre" components={components}><MDXTag name="code" components={components} parentName="pre" props={{"className":"language-yml"}}>{`apiVersion: v1
kind: ServiceAccount
metadata:
  name: eks-admin
  namespace: kube-system

---
apiVersion: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1beta1
kind: ClusterRoleBinding
metadata:
  name: eks-admin
roleRef:
  apiGroup: rbac.authorization.k8s.io
  kind: ClusterRole
  name: cluster-admin
subjects:
  - kind: ServiceAccount
    name: eks-admin
    namespace: kube-system
`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Run `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`kubectl apply -f admin-service-account.yml`}</MDXTag>{` to apply.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="pre" components={components}><MDXTag name="code" components={components} parentName="pre" props={{"className":"language-shell"}}>{`# Returned
serviceaccount/eks-admin created
clusterrolebinding.rbac.authorization.k8s.io/eks-admin created
`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"kubectl-proxy"}}>{`Kubectl proxy`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Now we should be able to run the proxy to see the dashboard! Ensure if you are port forwarding further if you need to see it on a particular host from a VM or docker image.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="pre" components={components}><MDXTag name="code" components={components} parentName="pre" props={{"className":"language-shell"}}>{`# This is to forward from Docker container to host
kubectl proxy --address='0.0.0.0' --port=8001 --accept-hosts='.*'

# Starting to serve on 127.0.0.1:8001
`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Now head to a browser at `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`http://localhost:8001/api/v1/namespaces/kube-system/services/https:kubernetes-dashboard:/proxy/#!/login`}</MDXTag>{` for login.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`To login with the token, we need the following:`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="pre" components={components}><MDXTag name="code" components={components} parentName="pre" props={{"className":"language-shell"}}>{`kubectl -n kube-system describe secret \$(kubectl -n kube-system get secret | grep eks-course-admin | awk '{print \$1}')
`}</MDXTag></MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`There is some more info here at `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`https://docs.aws.amazon.com/eks/latest/userguide/dashboard-tutorial.html`}</MDXTag>{`.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="h2" components={components} props={{"id":"chaos-testing"}}>{`Chaos testing`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="ul" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Simulating a failure of the frontend pods can be done using `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="li">{`kubectl delete pod <POD>`}</MDXTag>{`.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ul">{`Simulating a failure of the nodes is to just stop one of the three EC2 instances (can be done from AWS console easily). If a node goes down, the rest of the pods are distributed amongst the other nodes. If nodes are considered for autoscaling, then the EC2 instance will against restart another node.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Note, there is no automatic redeployment to the other nodes when a node becomes rescheduled. Killing some pods will of course help with rescheduling and distribution.`}</MDXTag>
           </MDXTag>
  }
}
